definition: to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
to seem/like/as/if
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: He acted as if nobody was around.
sentences.chinese: 他表演着，旁若无人的样子。
跳舞要旁若无人一样去跳。

sentences.english: Homeowners, armed with easy credit, snapped up properties as if they were playing Monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 有了宽松信贷的武装，房主们旁若无人般地抢购房产。

definition: each minding his own business
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
boldly/ostentatiously/poised/self-assured/Taiwan pr. [da4 mo2 da4 yang4]
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
arms around each other's shoulders (idiom)
to keep silent
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to be laughing and playing/to giggle
talking and laughing/to jest/cheerful and lively
to strut/swaggering
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
unhurried
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to turn a blind eye to
